TEXT.English: [H1]Yaroslav I the Wise[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Grand Prince of Kievan Rus[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] c. 978 - February 20, 1054 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Yaroslav I the Wise was thrice Grand Prince of Novgorod and Kiev, uniting the two principalities for a time under his rule. During his lengthy reign, Rus' reached the zenith of its cultural flowering and military power.[PARAGRAPH:2]After the death of his father Vladimir the Great, Yaroslav waged a complicated and bloody war for Kiev against his half-brother Sviatopolk, who was supported by his father-in-law, Duke Boleslaw I Chrobry of Poland. During the course of this struggle, several other brothers (Boris, Gleb, and Svyatoslav) were brutally murdered. The Primary Chronicle accused Svyatopolk of planning those murders, while the Saga of Eymund is often interpreted as recounting the story of Boris's assassination by the Varangians in the service of Yaroslav.[PARAGRAPH:2]Leaving aside the legitimacy of Yaroslav's claims to the Kievan throne and his postulated guilt in the murder of his brothers, Nestor the Chronicler and later Russian historians often presented him as a model of virtue, styling him "the Wise". Yaroslav was a notable patron of book culture and learning. In 1051, he had a Russian monk Ilarion proclaimed the metropolitan of Kiev, thus challenging old Byzantine tradition of placing Greeks on the episcopal sees. Ilarion's discourse on Yaroslav and his father Vladimir is frequently cited as the first work of Old Russian literature.[PARAGRAPH:2]In his foreign policy, Yaroslav relied on the Scandinavian alliance and attempted to weaken the Byzantine influence on Kiev. In 1030, he reconquered Red Rus from the Poles and concluded an alliance with King Casimir I of Poland, sealed by the latter's marriage to Yaroslav's sister Maria.[PARAGRAPH:2]To defend his state from the Pechenegs and other nomadic tribes threatening it from the south he constructed a line of forts, composed of Yuriev, Boguslav, Kaniv, Korsun, and Pereyaslav. To celebrate his decisive victory over the Pechenegs in 1036 (who thereupon never were a threat to Kiev) he sponsored the construction of the Saint Sophia Cathedral in 1037. Other celebrated monuments of his reign, such as the Golden Gates of Kiev, have since perished.[PARAGRAPH:2]In 1043, Yaroslav staged a naval raid against Constantinople led by his son Vladimir and general Vyshata. Although the Rus' navy was defeated, Yaroslav managed to conclude the war with a favourable treaty and prestigious marriage of his son Vsevolod to the emperor's daughter.
TEXT.French: [H1]Iaroslav le Sage[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Grand-prince de Kiev[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Dates:[\BOLD] c. 978 - February 20, 1054 AD[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Biographie:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Iaroslav Vladimirovitch, dit Iaroslav le Sage est le fils de Vladimir Ier. Né en 978, il est d'abord prince de Novgorod. Aprcs la mort de son pcre en 1015, il doit d'abord lutter contre son demi-frcre Sviatopolk Ier, soutenu par la Pologne mais il devint grand-prince de Kiev en 1019, aprcs sa victoire, mettant fin r la guerre civile au sein du Rus' de Kiev.[PARAGRAPH:2]En 1036, une grande victoire des Russes élimine la sempiternelle menace des Petchencgues. En 1038, Iaroslav marche contre les Iatviagues en 1040, il fait une expédition en Lituanie et en 1041, avec des bateaux, il attaque les Mazoviens. En revanche, une expédition lancée contre l'Empire byzantin, en 1043, par son fils aîné Vladimir, tourne au désastre. En 1047, il marche de nouveau contre les Mazoviens tue leur prince Modslav et les soumet au roi Casimir Ier le Restaurateur de Pologne.[PARAGRAPH:2]L'église de la sainte Mcre de Dieu qu'avait bâtie Vladimir Ier le pcre de Iarsolav est consacrée par le métropolitain Théopompte en 1039. Grand bâtisseur et législateur, il obtient des Byzantins que Kiev devienne le sicge d'un métropolite ruthcne (de la Rus'). R sa mort le 20 février 1054, son patrimoine est partagé entre ses 6 fils survivants dont trois lui succcderont comme Grand princes de Kiev.
TEXT.German: [H1]Jaroslaw I. der Weise[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Großfürst von Kiew[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lebte:[\BOLD] ca. 979/86 - 20. Februar 1054 n. Chr.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][TAB]Jaroslaw I. Wladimirowitsch, genannt der Weise, aus dem Geschlecht der Rurikiden, Großfürst von Kiew (1019-1054). Sohn Wladimirs I., des Heiligen, und Rognedas von Polozk.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Rurikiden gehörten den Rus an, der skandinavischstämmigen Führungsschicht, die sich seit der Mitte des 9. Jahrhunderts unter den Ostslawen niedergelassen und das Reich der Kiewer Rus gegründet hatte. Die Rurikiden waren bis zum Ende des 10. Jahrhunderts weitgehend slawisiert. Jaroslaws Vater Wladimir war 988 der erste Kiewer Großfürst, der das Christentum annahm und damit erheblich zum Aufstieg Kiews zur ostslawischen Hegemoniemacht beitrug.[NEWLINE]Nach einer Legende soll Jaroslaw um 1010 im Kampf eine mächtige Bärin bezwungen und an dieser Stelle die Stadt Jaroslawl gegründet haben.[PARAGRAPH:2]Jaroslaw hatte von seinem Vater nach dem Tod des älteren Bruders und designierten Thronfolgers Wyscheslaw die Herrschaft über die reiche Handelsstadt Nowgorod zugesprochen bekommen. 1014 weigerte Jaroslaw sich, seinem Vater den Tribut zu zahlen. Zu einem Feldzug Wladimirs gegen seinen Sohn kam es nicht mehr, weil Wladimir am 15. Juli 1015 starb.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dafür begannen sofort Nachfolgekämpfe zwischen Jaroslaw und seinen Brüdern und Onkeln. Zunächst konnte sich Jaroslaws Halbbruder Swjatopolk mit Hilfe seines Schwiegervaters, des polnischen Königs Boleslaw I. durchsetzen. Jaroslaw hielt sich aber in Nowgorod. Dort zog er ein Heer skandinavischer Krieger zusammen und schlug im Spätsommer 1016 Swjatopolk. Im Sommer 1017 griffen Jaroslaw I. und Kaiser Heinrich II. einer vorherigen Absprache folgend Boleslaw I. von zwei Seiten her an. Im darauf folgenden Sommer gelang es Boleslaw, Kiew zu erobern. Jaroslaw konnte zwar nach Nowgorod fliehen, seine weiblichen Verwandten und ein großer Goldschatz fielen jedoch in die Hände des polnischen Königs. Kurz darauf vertrieb Jaroslaw den erneut als Großfürst eingesetzten Swjatopolk wieder aus Kiew.[PARAGRAPH:2]Von 1029 bis 1031 wiederholte sich das Szenario von 1017: Wieder wurde Polen aus dem Westen, nun von Konrad II., und aus dem Osten von Jaroslaw angegriffen. Diesmal gelang es dem Großfürsten, weite Gebiete mit einem wichtigen Burgengürtel für Kiew zu erobern und kurzzeitig den ihm genehmen ältesten Sohn des 1025 verstorbenen Boleslaws und Bruder des über Polen herrschenden Mieszko II. Lambert, Bezprym, als Herrscher in Polen zu installieren. Nach der Ermordung Bezpryms im Jahre 1032 erlangte Mieszko seine Herrschaft zurück.[PARAGRAPH:2]Um 1035 herum begann Jaroslaw mit einer weitreichenden Heiratspolitik. Er selbst heiratete Ingigerd, die Tochter Olof Skötkonungs von Schweden. Seine Söhne und Töchter wurden in die Königshäuser Frankreichs (Anna), Norwegens, Ungarns, Byzanz' und an deutsche Fürsten verheiratet. Der polnische Thronanwärter Kasimir heiratete eine Schwester Jaroslaws, Maria Dobroniega, mit dessen Hilfe er sich als König von Polen durchsetzen konnte.[NEWLINE]1036 errang Jaroslaw I. den entscheidenden Sieg gegen das Reitervolk der Petschenegen. 1043 misslang ein Flottenangriff auf Konstantinopel.[NEWLINE]1019 erließ Jaroslaw I. die Russkaja Prawda, die erste russische Gesetzessammlung. Sie stellt eine Mischung byzantinischer Gesetze und slawischen Gewohnheitsrechts dar. Darüber hinaus versuchte er mit umfangreichen Nachfolgeregelungen, Erbstreitigkeiten nach seinem Tod zu verhindern, was allerdings nicht gelang. Vielmehr begründete er das Senioratsprinzip, das in den folgenden Jahrhunderten ein Grund dafür war, dass sich die russischen Fürstentümer kaum als feste Herrschaftsverbände stabilisieren konnten. Auf der Russkaja Prawda und der Schaffung des Senioratsprinzips beruht sein Beiname der Weise. Weitere Verdienste errang er durch den Stadtausbau von Kiew und Nowgorod, vor allem mit den Sophienkathedralen der beiden Städte. Sein Sarg liegt noch heute in der Sophienkathedrale von Kiew.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok also referred to as "Angkor Wat" is a temple in Angkor, Cambodia. Wat Preah Pisnulok was constructed in the 12th century by King Suryavaman II to serve as the royal palace and state temple, Hinduism being the state religion. Two or three centuries later Wat Preah Pisnulok was converted to Buddhist use. Wat Preah Pisnulok is a complex of buildings surrounded by a wall and then moat. The enclosed area measures 3000 feet by 2600 feet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Wat Preah Pisnulok is constructed primarily of sandstone blocks. The complex is laid out in a rectangular pattern somewhat resembling that of an ancient fortress; the inner buildings are separated from the outer walls by a courtyard similar to a bailey one might find in a castle. [PARAGRAPH:2]At one time the courtyard was filled with wooden buildings, but these have all since perished. The inner structure is split into three galleries built on raised platforms. The outer galleys once contained libraries, while the inner was a shrine to Vishnu (and has since been converted to a shrine to Buddha). The galleries are topped with towers that resemble stylized beehives, the tallest reaching about 140 feet in height. The buildings' walls are covered with ornate and beautiful bas relief sculptures depicting scenes from Hindu mythology. [PARAGRAPH:2]Though largely neglected in the latter half of the 20th century, serious efforts are now being made to preserve and restore this wonderful and unique place of worship, and pilgrims and tourists are visiting it in ever-greater numbers each year.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Angkor Vat est un temple situé à Angkor, au Cambodge. Il a été construit au XIIe siècle par le roi Suryavarman II pour servir de palais royal et de temple d'Etat, l'hindouisme étant la religion d'Etat. Deux ou trois siècles plus tard, il est transformé en temple bouddhiste. Angkor Vat est un complexe de bâtiments d'une surface totale de 1 500 m sur 1 300 m et entouré d'un mur et de douves. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Vat est construit essentiellement avec des blocs de grès, sur un modèle rectangulaire ressemblant à celui d'une ancienne forteresse. Les bâtiments intérieurs sont séparés des murs extérieurs par une cour, similaire à la cour intérieur que l'on pourrait trouver dans un château. [PARAGRAPH:2]A l'origine, la cour contenait des bâtiments en bois mais ils ont tous disparu. La structure intérieure est divisée en trois galeries construites sur des terrasses surélevées. Les galeries extérieures contenaient autrefois des bibliothèques tandis que celle du centre était un sanctuaire dédié à Vishnou (qui est désormais consacré à Bouddha). Les galeries sont surmontées de tours ressemblant à des ruches stylisées, les plus grandes pouvant mesurer près de 43 m de haut. Les murs des bâtiments sont recouverts de sculptures comportant de magnifiques bas-reliefs richement ornés représentant des scènes de la mythologie hindoue. [PARAGRAPH:2]Grandement négligé pendant la deuxième moitié du XXe siècle, de sérieux efforts sont désormais entrepris pour préserver et restaurer ce lieu de culte unique et magnifique. Chaque année, le nombre de visiteurs, qu'ils soient pèlerins ou touristes, ne cesse d'augmenter.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Angkor Wat ist ein Tempel im kambodschanischen Angkor. Er wurde im 12. Jahrhundert von König Suryavaman II. als Königspalast und Staatstempel errichtet. Angkor Wat war zunächst ein hinduistischer, später ein buddhistischer Tempel. Die Anlage besteht aus mehreren von einer Mauer und einem Graben umgebenen Gebäuden. Die Gesamtfläche der Tempelanlage beträgt 900 mal 800 Meter.[PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Wat wurde primär aus Sandsteinquadern gebaut. Der rechtwinklige Gebäudekomplex erinnert an die Struktur alter Festungen, zumal die inneren Gebäude durch einen Hof von der Außenmauer getrennt sind.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die auf dem Hof errichteten Holzgebäude sind nicht erhalten. Angkor Wat ist in drei Galerien auf erhöhten Plattformen unterteilt. Während in den äußeren Galerien Bibliotheken untergebracht waren, befand sich in der inneren Galerie zunächst ein Vishnu-, später ein Buddha-Schrein. Die Türme der Galerien erinnern an stilisierte Bienenstöcke. Der höchste Turm ist etwa 42 Meter hoch. Die Wände der Gebäude sind mit Flachreliefen verziert, die Szenen der Hindumythologie darstellen. [PARAGRAPH:2]Nachdem Angkor Wat in der zweiten Hälfte des 20. Jahrhunderts dem Verfall preisgegeben war, versucht man nun, diesen einzigartigen Ort, der Jahr für Jahr unzählige Pilger und Touristen anlockt, zu erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Angkor Wat è un tempio di Angkor in Cambogia, edificato nel XII secolo da re Suyavaman II: questa struttura era adibita a palazzo reale e tempio centrale, con l'Induismo come religione ufficiale. Due o tre secoli dopo, l'Angkor Wat venne convertito al Buddismo. Questo complesso, delle dimensioni di un chilometro per ottocentometri, ospitava molti edifici circondati da una muraglia e un fossato. [PARAGRAPH:2]Angkor Wat è costruito principalmente in pietra arenaria: il complesso è stato concepito a forma rettangolare e in qualche modo ricorda le antiche fortezze; gli edifici all'interno, sono separati dalle mura esterne da un cortile simile a quelli dei castelli. [PARAGRAPH:2]Un tempo, questo cortile ospitava degli edifici costruiti in legno che non hanno retto all'incedere della storia; la struttura interna è divisa in tre gallerie realizzate su piattaforme sopraelevate, mentre quelle esterne ospitavano biblioteche. La zona interna era un santuario dedicato a Vishnu (e successivamente riconvertito a Budda). In cima alle gallerie si trovano delle torri che ricordano la struttura degli alveari: la torre più alta raggiunge i 40 metri. Le mura dei palazzi sono ornate da meravigliosi bassorilievi che dipingono scene della mitologia Indù. [PARAGRAPH:2]Malgrado sia stato trascurato a metà del XX secolo, sono stati fatti molti sforzi per riportare questo tempio ai fasti di un tempo: ogni anno il luogo viene visitato da migliaia di pellegrini e turisti.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Angkor Wat es un templo en Angkor, Camboya. Fue construido en el s. XII por el rey Suryavaman II como palacio real y templo oficial, siendo el hinduismo la religión del estado. Dos o tres siglos más tarde se adaptó para ser utilizado por los budistas. Angkor Wat es un complejo de edificios rodeados por una muralla precedida de un foso. El recinto mide 915 x 790 metros aproximadamente. [PARAGRAPH:2]Está construido principalmente con bloques de piedra arenisca. El trazado del complejo tiene una forma rectangular que recuerda vagamente a la de una fortaleza; los edificios del interior están separados de la muralla exterior por un patio, de manera parecida al patio de armas que puede encontrarse en un castillo. [PARAGRAPH:2]En el pasado, el patio estaba repleto de edificios de madera, pero todos han desaparecido. La estructura interior está dividida por tres galerías construida sobre plataformas elevadas. Las galerías exteriores antaño contuvieron bibliotecas, mientras que la interior era un altar a Visnu (y ha sido convertido en uno a Buda). Las galerías están coronadas por torres que parecen colmenas estilizadas, la más alta alcanza cuarenta y cinco metros de altura. Las paredes de los edificios están cubiertas con hermosos y recargados bajorrelieves que representan escenas de la mitología hindú. [PARAGRAPH:2]Aunque se ha descuidado muchísimo durante la segunda mitad del s. XX, en la actualidad se están haciendo grandes esfuerzos por conservar y restaurar esta maravilla y lugar único de veneración, y el número de turistas y peregrinos que lo visitan aumenta año tras año.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An installation intended for the cooling, freezing, and cold storage of perishable food products and other perishables. It operates as an independent enterprise, comprises a cold-storage warehouse with truck and railroad platforms, compressor and condenser rooms for a refrigerating system, a cooling tower, reservoirs and a pumping station for a circulating water supply, administration and residential buildings, and other buildings and installations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Port cold-storage facilities are used for the short-term storage of freight when freight is transferred from one type of transport to another, for example, from water to railroad transport, and are usually built in river ports or seaports. Central cold-storage facilities are intended for the long-term storage of products drawn from processing-and-procurement cold-storage facilities for the purpose of creating reserves. Commercial cold-storage facilities, such as refrigerated cabinets and sectional coolers, are used for the short-term storage of products at trading depots and in, for example, stores, dining rooms, and restaurants. In addition to general-purpose cold-storage facilities, which are intended for the storage of a wide variety of products, specialized cold-storage facilities are built for the storage of such products as fruits, vegetables, eggs, and salted fish.

TEXT.English: Besides being the earliest civilization, the ancient Sumerians were known to have developed the first form of writing, Cuneiform. The word Cuneiform translates to 'wedge-shaped,' named for the tool that was used to carve this writing on clay tablets. The 'Edubba', literally meaning 'House of Tablets,' was the centre of learning in Mesopotamian cities. The 'House of Tablets' was the place where young Mesopotamian boys learned reading, writing, and mathematics. Young boys who graduated from the 'House of Tablets' lived to be scribes, writers, or scientists. Every city in Mesopotamia had an 'Edubba,' for it wasn't only a school; it was also a library for the public. The 'Edubba,' acquired its place in history for being the first to be institution of learning to be open to the public, a feature that wasn't available in ancient Egypt, and wasn't common until the time of the Romans and the Greeks, about 4000 years later.
TEXT.French: En plus d'être la civilisation la plus ancienne, les Sumériens sont connus pour avoir développé la première forme d'écriture, appelée cunéiforme. Ce mot, qui signifie ''en forme de coin", vient de l'outil utilisé pour graver les écrits sur des tablettes d'argile. L'Edubba, littéralement la "maison des tablettes", était le centre d'enseignement des villes mésopotamiennes. C'est là que les jeunes garçons apprenaient la lecture, l'écriture et les mathématiques. Ceux qui étaient diplômés de la maison des tablettes devenaient scribes, écrivains ou scientifiques. Chaque ville de Mésopotamie possédait une edduba, qui faisait aussi office d'école mais aussi de bibliothèque. L'édubba a été la première institution d'enseignement ouverte au public, une caractéristique que n'avait pas l'ancienne Egypte et qui ne s'est répandue qu'à l'époque des Romains et des Grecs, 4000 ans plus tard.
TEXT.German: Abgesehen davon, dass sie die früheste Zivilisation bildeten, sind die Sumerer der Antike auch dafür bekannt, die erste Form der Schrift entwickelt zu haben: die Keilschrift. Sie verdankt ihren Namen dem keilförmigen Instrument, einem Griffel aus Reet, das in den Sümpfen Südmesopotamiens wuchs, mit dem die Schriftzeichen in Tontafeln geritzt wurden. Das "Edubba", wörtlich übersetzt das "Tafelhaus", war das Bildungszentrum in mesopotamischen Städten. Im "Tafelhaus" (abgeleitet von den Tontafeln) wurden die jungen Mesopotamier im Lesen, Schreiben und Rechnen unterrichtet. Junge Männer verdingten sich nach Beendigung ihrer Ausbildung im "Tafelhaus" als Schreiber oder Gelehrte. Jede Stadt in Mesopotamien besaß ein "Edubba", denn es diente nicht nur als Schule, sondern auch als öffentliche Bibliothek. Weil es einerseits eine der ersten Schulen in der Menschheitsgeschichte darstellte und darüber hinaus auch noch für jedermann, hat sich das "Edubba", das "Tafelhaus", seinen Platz in der Geschichte redlich verdient - denn das gab es weder im alten Ägypten, noch war es bis zur Zeit der Römer und Griechen üblich, also erst 4.000 Jahre nachdem diese "öffentlichen Schulen" in Mesopotamien existiert hatten.
TEXT.Italian: Oltre a essere la prima civiltà, gli antichi Sumeri sono conosciuti per aver sviluppato la prima forma di scrittura, quella cuneiforme. La parola significa "a forma di cuneo", a causa dello strumento che veniva utilizzato per incidere sulle tavolette d'argilla. L'"Edubba", che letteralmente significa "casa delle tavolette", era il centro di educazione nelle città della Mesopotamia. Qui i giovani imparavano la matematica e a leggere e scrivere. I giovani che si diplomavano alla "casa delle tavolette" diventavano scribi, scrittori o scienziati. Ogni città della Mesopotamia aveva un'"Edubba", perché non era solo una scuola: era anche una biblioteca pubblica. L'"Edubba" si guadagnò un posto nella storia per essere stata la prima istituzione educativa aperta al pubblico, caratteristica che non era disponibile nell'antico Egitto, e che non divenne comune fino a Greci e Romani, circa 4000 anni più tardi.
TEXT.Spanish: Además de constituir la primera civilización, los antiguos sumerios son conocidos por haber desarrollado la primera forma de escritura, la cuneiforme. La palabra cuneiforme significa "con forma de cuña", y procede de la herramienta que se utilizaba para grabar los símbolos en tablas de arcilla. "Edubba" significa literalmente "casa de las tablas", y era el centro de aprendizaje de las ciudades de Mesopotamia. La "casa de las tablas" era el lugar en el que los jóvenes mesopotámicos aprendían a leer, escribir y a realizar cálculos matemáticos. Los jóvenes graduados en la "casa de las tablas" se convertían en escribas o científicos. Toda ciudad mesopotámica tenía una "Edubba", pues no solo era una escuela, sino que también hacía las veces de biblioteca pública. La "Edubba" ocupa su lugar en la historia como primera institución de enseñanza pública, algo que no se dio en el antiguo Egipto y que no se hizo común hasta los tiempos de los romanos y los griegos, unos 4.000 años más tarde.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Sultan Ahmed Mosque is a historical mosque in Istanbul, the largest city in Turkey and the capital of the Ottoman Empire from 1453 to 1923. The mosque is popularly known as the Blue Mosque for the blue tiles adorning the walls of its interior. It was built between 1609 and 1616, during the rule of Ahmed I. Like many other mosques, it also comprises a tomb of the founder, a madrasah and a hospice. [PARAGRAPH:1]The design of the Sultan Ahmed Mosque is the culmination of two centuries of both Ottoman mosque and Byzantine church development. It incorporates some Byzantine elements of the neighboring Hagia Sophia with traditional Islamic architecture and is considered to be the last great mosque of the classical period. The architect has ably synthesized the ideas of his master Sinan, aiming for overwhelming size, majesty and splendour.

[TAB]Borobudur is an 8th-century Mahayana Buddhist monument near Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia. The monument comprises six square platforms topped by three circular platforms, and is decorated with 2,672 relief panels and 504 Buddha statues. A main dome, located at the center of the top platform, is surrounded by 72 Buddha statues seated inside perforated stupa.[PARAGRAPH:2]The monument is both a shrine to the Lord Buddha and a place for Buddhist pilgrimage. The journey for pilgrims begins at the base of the monument and follows a path circumambulating the monument while ascending to the top through the three levels of Buddhist cosmology, namely Kamadhatu (the world of desire), Rupadhatu (the world of forms) and Arupadhatu (the world of formlessness). During the journey, the monument guides the pilgrims through a system of stairways and corridors with 1,460 narrative relief panels on the walls and the balustrades.[PARAGRAPH:2]Evidence suggests Borobudur was abandoned following the 14th-century decline of Buddhist and Hindu kingdoms in Java, and the Javanese conversion to Islam. Worldwide knowledge of its existence was sparked in 1814 by Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, then the British ruler of Java, who was advised of its location by native Indonesians. Borobudur has since been preserved through several restorations. The largest restoration project was undertaken between 1975 and 1982 by the Indonesian government and UNESCO, following which the monument was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Borobudur is still used for pilgrimage; once a year Buddhists in Indonesia celebrate Vesak at the monument, and Borobudur is Indonesia's single most visited tourist attraction.

[TAB]Brandenburg Gate is a former city gate and one of the main symbols of Berlin and Germany. It is located west of the city center at the intersection of Unter den Linden and Ebertstraße, immediately west of the Pariser Platz. It is the only remaining gate of a series through which one formerly entered Berlin. One block to the north stands the Reichstag. The gate is the monumental entry to Unter den Linden, the renowned boulevard of linden trees which formerly led directly to the city palace of the Prussian monarchs. It was commissioned by King Frederick William II of Prussia as a sign of peace and built by Karl Gotthard Langhans from 1788 to 1791. The Brandenburg Gate was restored from 2000 to 2002 by the Stiftung Denkmalschutz Berlin (Berlin Monument Conservation Foundation). Today, it is considered one of Europe's most famous landmarks.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Brandenburger Tor in Berlin steht am Pariser Platz in der Dorotheenstadt im Ortsteil Mitte (Bezirk Mitte). Es wurde in den Jahren von 1788 bis 1791 auf Anweisung des preußischen Königs Friedrich Wilhelm II. von Carl Gotthard Langhans errichtet und ist das bekannteste Wahrzeichen der Stadt. Zugleich ist das Tor ein nationales Symbol, mit dem viele wichtige Ereignisse der Geschichte Berlins, Deutschlands, Europas und der Welt des 20. Jahrhunderts verbunden sind. Der Bau ist dem frühklassizistischen Stil zuzuordnen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Mit dem Bau der Zollmauer der Stadt Berlin wurde 1734 ein Vorgängerbau des heutigen Brandenburger Tores als Stadttor an der Straße nach Brandenburg an der Havel errichtet. Die Toranlage bestand aus Pylonen und beigeordneten Wachhäusern. Im Zuge des Ausbaus der Mauer und ihrer Tore ließ Friedrich Wilhelm II. ab 1788 das Brandenburger Tor neu gestalten, das dem Andenken an den Krieg des kurz zuvor verstorbenen Friedrich II. diente, von dessen Verdiensten auch etwas Glanz auf den Neffen und Nachfolger fallen sollte.[PARAGRAPH:2]Als Architekt wurde Carl Gotthard Langhans beauftragt. Er orientierte sich an dem "Stadttor von Athen", das er aus Stichen von Leroy, Stuart und Revett kannte, die aber die Propyläen der Athener Akropolis abgebildet hatten. Das Eingangstor zur Akropolis war im dorischen Stil des Parthenon gehalten, um eine optische Einheit zu bilden. Das Tor hatte eine breite Mittelöffnung und zwei schmale Seiteneingänge für Fußgänger. Im rechten Winkel dazu standen zwei Seitenflügel. Nach Langhans Planung sollten entsprechend beim Berliner Tor durch den breiten Mittelgang die königlichen Kutschen, daneben die sonstigen Gespanne fahren und außen die Fußgänger gehen. In den Seitenflügeln sollten die Wache und die Akziseeinnehmer untergebracht werden. 1788 wurde das alte Tor abgerissen, eine große Baugrube ausgehoben und fundamentiert. 1789 wurde der Neubau begonnen. Die Baukosten lagen bei 111.000 Talern. Am 6. August 1791 wurde das noch nicht ganz fertige Tor geöffnet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die 1793 von Johann Gottfried Schadow gefertigte Quadriga auf dem Brandenburger Tor stellte ursprünglich nach der wohl überwiegend vertretenen Auffassung eine geflügelte Friedensbringerin dar. Das Brandenburger Tor erhielt den Namen Friedenstor, diesen Namen zeigte auch eine Inschrift aus Bronzelettern am Tor. Diese Sinngebung interpretiert auch der bildliche Schmuck. Die Entwürfe für die Reliefs wurden vorwiegend von dem Maler und Akademiedirektor Christian Bernhard Rode angefertigt. Schadow hat die Entwürfe überarbeitet und die Steinmetze bei der Ausführung beaufsichtigt. Die Göttin in der Quadriga wird durch das Relief auf der Attika der Stadtseite als Friedensbringerin erklärt. Das Attikarelief steht unter dem Thema "Der Zug der Friedensgöttin". Im Zentrum des Reliefs über dem Mittelgang stehen Sinnbilder auf Frieden und Freundschaft. Die Friedensgöttin Eirene steht auf der äußersten Kante eines Triumphwagens. Mit der Rechten stützt sie sich auf den mit einer Lorbeergirlande geschmückten Rand des Wagens. In der einen Hand hält sie einen Palmenzweig, in der anderen einen Lorbeerkranz. Ihr Wagen wird von vier Eroten gezogen. Weiter rechts auf dem Attikarelief kann man Nike mit Flügeln und Tropaion erkennen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Direkt über diesem Relief steht die Quadriga Schadows. Deren göttliche Wagenlenkerin ist Nike und Eirene in einer Person. Nach einer abweichenden Auffassung soll es sich von Anfang an um eine "Siegesgöttin" gehandelt haben, unter anderem weil davon bereits im Vertrag zur Anfertigung der Figurengruppe vom 22. Juli 1789 die Rede gewesen sei. Schadow hatte ursprünglich für die Wagenlenkerin keine Trophäe entworfen. Ihm schwebte mehr die griechische Eirene als Friedensgöttin vor, als die römische Siegesgöttin Viktoria. 1793 verlangte dann aber ein Akademiebeschluss eine Kopie der Siegestrophäe der Nike rechts auf dem Attikarelief auch für die Wagenlenkerin der Quadriga. Bei der Bevölkerung fand sie keinen Zuspruch. Aufgrund heftiger Kritik besserte Schadow noch ein weiteres Mal nach. Das Tropaion wurde nun durch eine Lanze mit einem Lorbeerkranz und einem römischen Adler ersetzt. Außerdem erhielt die knapp bekleidete Wagenlenkerin nun ein bis auf den Boden reichendes Gewand.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the mid-19th century, Brazil had been undergoing an economic transformation brought about by a new export crop: coffee. Coffee provided a new basis for agricultural expansion in southern Brazil. In the provinces of Rio de Janeiro and then São Paulo, coffee estates, or fazendas, began to spread toward the interior as new lands were opened. By 1850, coffee made up more than 50% of Brazil's exports, and more than half of world coffee production.[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the expansion of coffee growing came an intensification of slavery in Brazil, as the country's primary form of labor. More than 1.4 million Africans were forced to be slaves in Brazil in the last 50 years of the slave trade, and even after the trans-Atlantic slave trade ended, slavery continued until 1888.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because of the increased profit from the trade of coffee, the years after 1850 saw considerable growth and prosperity in Brazil. Dom Pedro II proved to be an enlightened man of middle-class habits who was anxious to reign over a tranquil and progressive nation, even if that tranquility was based on slave labor. Railroads, steamships and the telegraph were introduced to Brazil, all paid for by the money the fazendas supplied from their coffee crop. In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.[PARAGRAPH:1]

In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.[PARAGRAPH:1]
TEXT.German: [TAB]In the mid-19th century, Brazil had been undergoing an economic transformation brought about by a new export crop: coffee. Coffee provided a new basis for agricultural expansion in southern Brazil. In the provinces of Rio de Janeiro and then São Paulo, coffee estates, or fazendas, began to spread toward the interior as new lands were opened. By 1850, coffee made up more than 50% of Brazil's exports, and more than half of world coffee production.[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the expansion of coffee growing came an intensification of slavery in Brazil, as the country's primary form of labor. More than 1.4 million Africans were forced to be slaves in Brazil in the last 50 years of the slave trade, and even after the trans-Atlantic slave trade ended, slavery continued until 1888.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because of the increased profit from the trade of coffee, the years after 1850 saw considerable growth and prosperity in Brazil. Dom Pedro II proved to be an enlightened man of middle-class habits who was anxious to reign over a tranquil and progressive nation, even if that tranquility was based on slave labor. Railroads, steamships and the telegraph were introduced to Brazil, all paid for by the money the fazendas supplied from their coffee crop. In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.[PARAGRAPH:1]

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wembley Stadium is one of the world's most famous football stadiums, located in Wembley, London. In 2003, the original structure was demolished, to be replaced by a new one due to open in 2007. When complete, the new Wembley Stadium will be the largest roof-covered football stadium in Europe. First known as the Empire Stadium, the original stadium was built for the British Empire Exhibition of 1924. The first event held at the stadium was the FA Cup final on 28 April 1923 between Bolton Wanderers and West Ham United.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le stade de Wembley est l'un des stades de football les plus connus au monde. Il est situé dans le quartier de Wembley à Londres. En 2003, la structure originale fut détruite afin de laisser place à un nouveau stade dont l'inauguration est prévue pour 2007. Une fois achevé, le nouveau stade de Wembley sera le plus grand stade de football couvert d'Europe. D'abord connu sous le nom d'Empire Stadium, le premier stade fut construit pour l'exposition de l'Empire britannique de 1924. Le premier événement organisé dans ce stade fut la finale de la FA Cup du 28 avril 1923, qui opposa le Bolton Wanderers au West Ham United.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Wembley-Stadion in Wembley, einem Londoner Teil des Londoner Stadtbezirks Brent, zählt zu den berühmtesten Fußballstadien der Welt. Nach dem Abriss des alten Stadiongebäudes im Jahr 2003 wurde der Neubau im Jahr 2007 feierlich wiedereröffnet und repräsentiert nun das zweitgrößte Stadion Europas und das weltweit größte mit einem beweglichen Dach. Ursprünglich wurde das Wembley-Stadion als Empire Stadion für die British Empire Exhibition des Jahres 1924 gebaut. Die erste Veranstaltung in diesem Stadion war am 28. April 1923 das Football Association Challenge Cup (FA Cup)-Finale zwischen den Bolton Wanderers und West Ham United.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Lo stadio di Wembley è uno dei più famosi stadi di calcio al mondo e si trova a Wembley, Londra. Nel 2003 la struttura originaria venne demolita per essere rimpiazzata da un'altra, aperta nel 2007. Lo stadio di Wembley (nuovo) è il più grande stadio calcistico al coperto d'Europa. Inizialmente conosciuto come Empire Stadium, lo stadio originale venne costruito per l'esibizione del British Empire nel 1924. Il primo evento che si tenne allo stadio fu la finale di Coppa d'Inghilterra del 28 aprile 1923, tra i Bolton Wanderers e il West Ham United.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El estadio de Wembley es uno de los estadios de fútbol más famosos y se encuentra en Wembley, Londres. En el año 2003 se demolió la estructura original, que ha sido reemplazada por un estadio nuevo en el 2007. El Nuevo Estadio de Wembley es el estadio cubierto más grande de Europa. El estadio original, que entonces llevaba el nombre de "Empire Stadium" o "Estadio Imperial", se construyó con motivo de la "British Empire Exhibition" de 1924. El primer evento celebrado en el estadio fue la final de la Copa FA, el 28 de abril de 1923, entre el Bolton Wanderers y el West Ham United.

TEXT.English: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) (French: Gendarmerie royale du Canada (GRC), literally 'Royal Gendarmerie of Canada'; colloquially known as the Mounties, and internally as 'the Force') is both a federal and a national police force of Canada, and one of the most recognized of its kind in the world. It is unique in the world as a national, federal, provincial, and municipal policing body. The RCMP provides policing services to all of Canada at a federal level, and also on a contract basis to the three territories, eight of Canada's provinces (the RCMP does not provide provincial or municipal policing in either Ontario or Quebec), more than 190 municipalities, 184 aboriginal communities, and three international airports.

[TAB]A caravanserai was a roadside inn where travelers could rest and recover from the day's journey. Caravanserais supported the flow of commerce, information, and people across the network of trade routes covering Asia, North Africa, and South-Eastern Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]Most typically a caravanserai was a building with a square or rectangular walled exterior, with a single portal wide enough to permit large or heavily laden beasts such as camels to enter. The courtyard was almost always open to the sky, and the inside walls of the enclosure were outfitted with a number of identical stalls, bays, niches, or chambers to accommodate merchants and their servants, animals, and merchandise. [PARAGRAPH:1]Caravanserais provided water for human and animal consumption, washing, and ritual ablutions. Sometimes they even had elaborate baths. They also kept fodder for animals and had shops for travellers where they could acquire new supplies. In addition, there could be shops where merchants could dispose of some of their goods.

[TAB]The European Organization for Nuclear Research (French: Organisation européenne pour la recherche nucléaire), known as CERN or Cern is an international organization whose purpose is to operate the world's largest particle physics laboratory, in the northwest suburbs of Geneva on the Franco-Swiss border. Established in 1954, the organization has 20 European member states.[PARAGRAPH:1]The term CERN is also used to refer to the laboratory, which employs just under 2,400 full-time employees, 1,500 part-time employees, and hosts some 10,000 visiting scientists and engineers, representing 608 universities and research facilities and 113 nationalities.[PARAGRAPH:1]CERN's main function is to provide the particle accelerators and other infrastructure needed for high-energy physics research. Numerous experiments have been constructed at CERN by international collaborations to make use of them. It is also the birthplace of the World Wide Web. The main site at Meyrin also has a large computer centre containing very powerful data-processing facilities primarily for experimental data analysis and, because of the need to make them available to researchers elsewhere, has historically been a major wide area networking hub.

[TAB]The Channel Tunnel (French: le tunnel sous la Manche) is a 31 mile (50.5 km)-long rail tunnel beneath the English Channel at the Straits of Dover, connecting Folkestone, Kent in England to Coquelles near Calais in northern France. A long-standing and very expensive megaproject that saw several false starts, it was finally completed in 1994. It is the second-longest rail tunnel in the world, with the Seikan Tunnel in Japan being longer, but the undersea section of 24 miles (39 km) is the longest of its kind in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le tunnel sous la Manche est un tunnel ferroviaire long de 49,7 km, qui effectue la liaison entre Coquelles (près de Calais) dans le Nord de la France et Folkestone dans le Kent, en Angleterre. Après avoir été plusieurs fois abandonné, ce projet colossal au budget faramineux fut finalement achevé en 1994. Le tunnel sous la Manche est le deuxième plus grand tunnel au monde, le premier étant le tunnel du Seikan au Japon. Sa section sous la mer (37,3 km) est toutefois la plus longue au monde.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Eurotunnel oder Kanaltunnel ist ein 50 km langer Eisenbahntunnel, der unterhalb des Ärmelkanals an der Meerenge von Dover verläuft. Er verbindet Folkeston in Kent (England) und Coquelle nahe Calais in Nordfrankreich. Das langwierige und äußerst kostspielige Mega-Bauprojekt, dem einige fehlgeschlagene Tunnelbauversuche vorangingen, wurde schließlich 1994 vollendet. Der Tunnel ist nach dem Seikan-Tunnel in Japan der zweitlängste Eisenbahntunnel der Welt, wobei der 37,9 Kilometer lange unterseeische Tunnelabschnitt bislang weltweit unübertroffen ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il canale della Manica (in francese: le tunnel sous la Manche) è un tunnel lungo 50,5 km che passa sotto la manica all'altezza dello stretto di Dover e collega Folkestone, Kent in Inghilterra con Coquelles, vicino a Calais nella Francia settentrionale. Si tratta di un mega progetto che è rimasto in ballo molto tempo e ha avuto molte false partenze, ed è stato finalmente completato nel 1994. È il secondo tunnel ferroviario più lungo al mondo: è superato solo dal tunnel Seikan in Giappone, ma la sezione subacquea di 39 km è la più lunga al mondo, nel suo genere.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Eurotúnel es un túnel de cincuenta kilómetros y medio que recorre el subsuelo del Canal de la Mancha y que conecta Folkestone, Kent, en Inglaterra, con Coquelles, cerca de Calais, en el norte de Francia. Se trata de un largo y caro proyecto que, tras varias salidas en falso, fue finalmente terminado en 1994. Es el segundo túnel para transporte ferroviario más largo del mundo, después del Túnel Seikan japonés. Sin embargo, su sección submarina, de 39 kilómetros, es la más larga del mundo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Temple of Kukulkan (also known as El Castillo or the Temple of Quetzalcoatl) is one of the best-known Mayan buildings in Chichen Itza. The structure itself is a typical four-sided step temple, but at its base rests stone pillars carved with feathered serpents (revealing the strong Toltec/Aztec influence). Many archeologists believe that its design is based upon the Mayan calendar, since each stairway has 90 steps. Add the total steps to the number of stairways plus the top platform, and you reach the number of 365 (the number of days in [our] typical calendar year).
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le temple de Quetzalcóatl (aussi appelé la Citadelle ou le temple de Kukulcán) est l'un des bâtiments mayas les plus connus sur le site de Chichén Itzá. L'ouvrage est une simple pyramide à degrés à quatre côtés, mais on trouve à sa base des piliers en pierre sur lesquels sont gravés des serpents à plumes, révélant la forte influence toltèque et aztèque. Beaucoup d'archéologues pensent que ce temple fut conçu d'après le calendrier maya, car chaque escalier compte 90 marches. Si l'on fait le total des marches et des escaliers, et qu'on ajoute la plate-forme au sommet, on obtient le nombre 365, soit le nombre de jours d'une année civile classique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Pyramide des Kukulcán (auch El Castillo oder Tempel des Quetzalcoatl genannt) ist eines der bekanntesten Maya-Bauwerke in Chichen Itza. Das Gebäude selbst ist eine typische vierseitige Stufenpyramide, an deren Fuß allerdings Steinsäulen mit eingemeißelten gefiederten Schlangen angebracht sind (was den starken toltekischen/aztekischen Einfluss widerspiegelt). Viele Archäologen glauben, dass dieses Design auf dem Maya-Kalender basiert, da jeder Treppenabschnitt 90 Stufen hat. Addiert man die Gesamtzahl der Stufen und zählt dann die Anzahl der Treppenabschnitte plus der Dachplattform hinzu, so erhält man die Zahl 365 (die Anzahl der Tage in [unserem] gewöhnlichen Kalenderjahr).
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Tempio di Kukulcan (conosciuto anche come El Castillo o Tempio di Quetzalcoatl) è uno degli edifici maya meglio conosciuti di Chichen Itza. La struttura è quella tipica di un tempo con quattro lati, ma alla base si trovano colonne di pietra scolpite con serpenti piumati (che rivelano la forte influenza tolteca/azteca). Molti archeologi credono che il progetto si basi sul calendario maya, visto che ogni scala ha 90 scalini. Sommando il numero di scalini delle quattro scale a quelli della piattaforma sovrastante si ottiene 365 (il numero di giorni nel [nostro] anno).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Templo de Kukulcán (también conocido como "El Castillo" o el "Templo de Quetzalcoatl") es uno de los edificios mayas más conocidos de Chichen Itzá. La estructura en sí es un templo típico con cuatro paredes inclinadas y con escalones, pero en su base descansan unos pilares de piedra grabados con serpientes emplumadas (lo cual evidencia la fuerte influencia tolteca/azteca). Muchos arqueólogos creen que su diseño está basado en el calendario maya, pues todas las escaleras tienen noventa peldaños. Al sumar el número de peldaños al de escaleras y a la plataforma superior, obtenemos los 365 días que tiene el año según nuestro calendario.

TEXT.English: Taixue (literally "Greatest Study or Learning"), or sometimes called the "Imperial Academy", "Imperial School", "Imperial University" or "Imperial Central University", was the highest rank of educational establishment in Ancient China between the Han Dynasty and Sui Dynasty. It was replaced by the Guozijian. The first nationwide government school system in China was established in 3 AD under Emperor Ping of Han, with the taixue located in the capital of Chang'an and local schools established in the prefectures and in the main cities of the smaller counties.[PARAGRAPH:1]Taixue taught Confucianism and Chinese literature among other things for the high level civil service, although a civil service system based upon examination rather than recommendation was not introduced until the Sui and not perfected until the Song Dynasty (960-1279).

[TAB]Hacienda is a Spanish word for an estate. Some haciendas were plantations, mines or factories. Many haciendas combined these productive activities. The hacienda aimed for self-sufficiency in everything but luxuries meant for display, which were destined for the handful of people in the circle of the patrón, also known as the hacendado.[PARAGRAPH:1]Haciendas originated in land grants, mostly made to conquistadors. It is in Mexico that the hacienda system can be considered to have its origin in 1529, when the Spanish crown granted to Hernán Cortés the title of Marquess of the Valley of Oaxaca, which entailed a tract of land that included all of the present state of Morelos. Significantly, Cortés was also granted an encomienda, which included all the Native Americans then living on the land, and with power of life and death every person on his domains.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dome of the Rock is located at the visual center of an ancient man-made platform known as the Temple Mount, which Muslims refer to as the "Noble Sanctuary". The platform, greatly enlarged under the rule of Herod the Great, is the site of the Second Jewish Temple which was destroyed during the Roman Siege of Jerusalem in 70 AD. In 637 AD, Jerusalem was conquered by the Rashidun Caliphate army during the Islamic invasion of the Byzantine Empire.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Dome of the Rock was erected between 685 and 691 AD. The names of the two engineers in charge of the project are given as: Yazid Ibn Salam from Jerusalem and Raja Ibn Haywah from Baysan. Umayyad Caliph Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan who initiated construction of the Dome, hoped that it would "house the Muslims from cold and heat" and intended the building to serve as a shrine for pilgrims and not as a mosque for public worship. Historians contend that the Caliph wished to create a structure which would compete with the existing buildings of other religions in the city. al-Maqdisi writes that he "Sought to build for the Muslims a masjid that should be unique and a wonder to the world. And in like manner, is it not evident that Caliph Abd al-Malik, seeing the greatness of the martyrium of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and its magnificence was moved lest it should dazzle the minds of Muslims and hence erected above the Rock the dome which is now seen there."[PARAGRAPH:2]During the Crusades the Dome of the Rock was given to the Augustinians, who turned it into a church, and the Al-Aqsa Mosque became the royal palace of Baldwin I of Jerusalem in 1104. The Knights Templar, who believed the Dome of the Rock was the site of the Temple of Solomon, set up their headquarters in the Al-Aqsa Mosque adjacent to the Dome for much of the 12th century. The "Templum Domini," as they called it, was featured on the official seals of the Order's Grand Masters, and it became the architectural model for Templar churches across Europe.[PARAGRAPH:2]Jerusalem was recaptured by Saladin on Friday, 2 October 1187 and the Haram was reconsecrated as a Muslim sanctuary. The cross on top of the Dome of the Rock was replaced by a golden crescent and a wooden screen was placed around the rock below. Salah al-Din's nephew al-Malik al-Mu'azzam Isa (615-24/1218-27) carried out other restorations within the Haram and added the porch to the Aqsa mosque.[PARAGRAPH:2]Large-scale renovation was undertaken during the reign of Mahmud II in 1817. Adjacent to the Dome of the Rock, the Ottomans built the free-standing Dome of the Prophet in 1620.[PARAGRAPH:2]The Dome of the Rock was badly shaken during an earthquake in Palestine on Monday, 11 July 1927 rendering useless many of the repairs that had taken place over previous years.[PARAGRAPH:2]Under Jordanian rule of Jerusalem, Jews were forbidden from entering the Old City. Israel took control of the Dome of the Rock during its victory in the Six-Day War in 1967. A few hours after the Israeli flag was hoisted over the Dome of the Rock in 1967, at the conclusion of the Six-Day War, Israelis lowered it on the orders of General Moshe Dayan, and invested the Muslim Waqf (religious trust) with the authority to manage the Temple Mount-Haram al-Sharif in order to "keep the peace".[PARAGRAPH:2]The Dome of the Rock, being among a complex of buildings on the Temple Mount, (the other principal building being the Al-Aqsa Mosque) is one of the holiest sites in Islam, following Mecca, Medina, and, for shia Muslims, the Imam Ali Mosque. Its significance stems from the religious beliefs regarding the rock at its heart. According to Islamic tradition, the rock is the spot from where Muhammad ascended to Heaven accompanied by the angel Gabriel.[PARAGRAPH:2]The stone over which the Muslim shrine, the Dome of Rock, was built is the holiest site in Judaism. Jews have traditionally regarded the location of the stone as the holiest spot on Earth, the site of the Holy of Holies during the Temple Period. In former times, some Jewish scholars thought that the location of the Holy of Holies was not known for certain. Today this is a minority opinion.[PARAGRAPH:2]Just as Muslims pray towards the Kaaba at Mecca, the holiest site in Islam, Jews pray towards the site of the ancient Holy of Holies, the Foundation Stone, the holiest site in Judaism.[PARAGRAPH:2]In Christianity it is believed that during the time of the Byzantine Empire, nearby the spot where the Dome was later constructed was where Constantine's mother built a small church, calling it the Church of St. Cyrus and St. John, later on enlarged and called the Church of the Holy Wisdom. On the walls of the Dome of the Rock is an inscription in a mosaic frieze that includes the following words:[PARAGRAPH:2]"Bless your envoy and your servant Jesus son of Mary and peace upon him on the day of birth and on the day of death and on the day he is raised up again. It is a word of truth in which they doubt. It is not for God to take a son. Glory be to him when he decrees a thing he only says be, and it is."
TEXT.German: Der Felsendom ist das wohl bekannteste Wahrzeichen Jerusalems und eines der Hauptheiligtümer des Islam. Er befindet sich auf dem Tempelberg im südöstlichen Teil der Altstadt von Jerusalem. Der Felsendom ist der älteste islamische Sakralbau und stellt ein Meisterwerk der islamischen Baukunst des frühen Umayyadenstils dar, in welchem die Übernahme des frühchristlich-byzantinischen Zentralbautyps zum Ausdruck kommt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Der Kuppelbau wurde über dem Felsen (Sachra) errichtet, auf welchem Abraham der biblischen Erzählung nach seinen Sohn Isaak zu opfern bereit war und wo die Himmelfahrt Mohammeds stattgefunden haben soll. Er ist ursprünglich - und auch heute - nicht als Moschee, sondern als ein Schrein beziehungsweise eine Kuppel verstanden worden.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Erbauung des Felsendoms wird in der neueren Forschung dem Kalifen ?Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan (regierte 685-705) sowie dessen Sohn und Nachfolger al-Walid ibn ?Abd al-Malik (reg. 705-715), der auch den Bau der al-Aqsa-Moschee weitergeführt haben soll, zugeschrieben. Die Bauinschrift in archaischem kufischen Duktus, die über dem Kranzgesims an der Kuppel erhalten ist, dokumentiert nicht nur den Namen des Erbauers, sondern auch die ursprüngliche Bezeichnung der Anlage, die man lediglich als Kuppel (Qubba) verstanden hat; der hier in Klammern stehende Namensteil ist vom Abbasidenkalifen Al-Ma?mun getilgt und durch seinen eigenen Namen ersetzt worden.

TEXT.English: Diplomacy has been a common practice for millennia, but for the majority of human history, ambassadors were sent only for specific negotiations and would return immediately after their mission concluded. Modern diplomacy's origins can be traced to the states of Northern Italy in the early Renaissance, where the first embassies - permanent diplomatic stations - were established. Beginning in the city of Milan, this trend would spread across Europe and eventually, the world.
TEXT.French: La diplomatie est une pratique courante depuis des millénaires mais pendant très longtemps, les ambassadeurs n'étaient envoyés que pour des négociations spécifiques et repartaient une fois leur mission achevée. Les origines de la diplomatie moderne remontent au début de la Renaissance, dans les états du nord de l'Italie, où les premières ambassades permanentes furent créées. Cette tendance, née à Milan, s'étendra à l'Europe, puis au monde entier.
TEXT.German: Die Diplomatie ist schon seit Jahrtausenden allgemein gängige Praxis, allerdings war es die meiste Zeit der Menschheitsgeschichte üblich, dass Diplomaten bzw. Botschafter ausschließlich für bestimmte Verhandlungen in fremde Länder entsandt wurden und nach Erfüllung ihrer Mission umgehend wieder in ihre Heimat zurückkehrten. Die Ursprünge der modernen Diplomatie gehen auf die norditalienischen Stadtstaaten der frühen Renaissance zurück, wo seinerzeit erste Botschaftsgebäude als ständige diplomatische Vertretungen eingerichtet wurden. Ausgehend von der Stadt Mailand wurde diese Tradition bald in ganz Europa und schließlich auch weltweit übernommen.
TEXT.Italian: La diplomazia si pratica da millenni ma, per la maggior parte dei casi nella storia umana, gli ambasciatori erano inviati solo per specifici negoziati e tornavano immediatamente dopo aver terminato la propria missione. Le origini della diplomazia moderna si possono far risalire agli stati del nord Italia nel primo Rinascimento, quando furono stabilite le prime stazioni diplomatiche fisse, le ambasciate. Cominciato nella città di Milano, questo costume si sarebbe diffuso in tutta Europa e, successivamente, nel mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: La diplomacia lleva siendo práctica común desde hace milenios pero, durante la mayor parte de la historia, solo se enviaban embajadores con misiones concretas que regresaban al término de sus negociaciones. Los orígenes de la diplomacia moderna se encuentran en los estados del norte de Italia, a comienzos del Renacimiento, con el establecimiento de las primeras embajadas, o misiones diplomáticas permanentes. Esta moda que se inició en Milán no tardaría en extenderse por toda Europa y, más tarde, por todo el mundo.

TEXT.English: The Empire State Building is a 102-story landmark Art Deco skyscraper in New York City at the intersection of Fifth Avenue and West 34th Street. Its name is derived from the nickname for New York, The Empire State. It stood as the world's tallest building for more than 40 years, from its completion in 1931 until construction of the World Trade Center's North Tower was completed in 1972. Following the terrorist bombing and destruction of the World Trade Center in 2001, the Empire State Building again became the tallest building in New York City.

[TAB]The Colosseum or Coliseum, situated in Rome and originally known as the Flavian Amphitheatre (Latin: Amphitheatrum Flavium), is the largest amphitheatre built in the Roman Empire. Originally capable of seating 50,000 spectators, it was used for gladiatorial combat. Construction of the Flavian Amphitheatre began under the rule of Emperor Vespasian in 72 AD. It was completed by his son, Titus, in 80 AD, with later improvements by Domitian.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Colisée de Rome, appelé à l'origine "amphithéâtre Flavien" (en latin : Amphitheatrum Flavium), est le plus grand amphithéâtre construit dans l'Empire romain. Il pouvait contenir à l'origine 50 000 spectateurs et servait à organiser des combats de gladiateurs. La construction de l'amphithéâtre Flavien fut lancée sous Vespasien, en 72 apr. J.-C. L'ouvrage fut achevé par son fils, Titus, en 80 apr. J.-C., puis amélioré par Domitien.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Kolosseum (Lateinisch: Amphitheatrum Novum oder Amphitheatrum Flavium) ist das größte der im antiken Rom erbauten Amphitheater. Es fasste ursprünglich 50.000 Zuschauer und diente vor allem als Schauplatz für Gladiatorenkämpfe. Der Bau des Amphitheatrum Flavium wurde im Jahr 72 n. Chr. von Kaiser Vespasian in Auftrag gegeben und im Jahr 80 n. Chr. von seinem Sohn Titus vollendet. Dessen Bruder Domitian ließ später noch einige Erweiterungen und Verbesserungen an dem Gebäude vornehmen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Colosseo, situato a Roma e originariamente conosciuto come Anfiteatro Flavio (in latino: Amphitheatrum Flavium), è il più grande anfiteatro costruito nell'impero romano. In origine era in grado di ospitare 50.000 spettatori e veniva utilizzato per i giochi gladiatòri. La costruzione dell'Anfiteatro Flavio iniziò sotto l'imperatore Vespasiano nel 72 d.C e venne completata sotto il regno del figlio, Tito, nell'80 d.C., con ulteriori modifiche apportate durante il regno di Domiziano.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Coliseo de Roma, que en su origen fue conocido como Anfiteatro Flavio (del latín, "Amphitheatrum Flavium"), es el anfiteatro más grande construido por el Imperio Romano. Era capaz de alojar a 50.000 espectadores durante los combates de gladiadores. La construcción del Anfiteatro Flavio se inició durante el mandato del emperador Vespasiano en el 72 d. C. Fue inaugurado por su hijo Tito en el 80 d. C., aunque en realidad fue Domiciano quien lo completó, dos años más tarde.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Floating Garden is a method of ancient Mesoamerican agriculture which used small, rectangle-shaped areas of fertile arable land to grow crops on the shallow lake beds in the Valley of Mexico. Often referred to as "floating gardens," Floating Gardens were artificial islands that usually measured roughly 30 × 2.5 m (98 × 8.2 ft), although they were sometimes longer. They were created by staking out the shallow lake bed and then fencing in the rectangle with wattle. The fenced-off area was then layered with mud, lake sediment, and decaying vegetation, eventually bringing it above the level of the lake. Often trees were planted at the corners to secure the Floating Garden. Floating Gardens were separated by channels wide enough for a canoe to pass.

A cold storage plant is an industrial plant in which meat or vegetables are stored for later marketing. Meat from animals (cattle, pigs, fish, birds) after slaughter follow a natural process: the attack of microorganisms, which, at room temperature, degrade tissues. The meat is no longer edible in 2-3 days. Keeping the meat at low temperatures, the process of deterioration can be avoided, and so, meat can be consumed several months after the slaughter. Offering the fruits and meats for a longer period of time has an economic and alimentary importance. For this, the products are stored in refrigerated rooms at a suitable temperature and humidity, what allows the consumption of the products long after they were harvested.

[TAB]An opera house is a building where operas are performed. The venues are usually constructed specifically with opera in mind, although other performing arts may be performed there. Notable opera houses include London's Globe Theater, where most of the plays of William Shakespeare were first performed on the stage, the Sydney Opera House, one of the most distinctive and famous 20th century buildings and La Scala in Milan.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un opéra est un bâtiment où sont représentés les opéras. Les lieux sont généralement pensés pour l'opéra, mais peuvent servir pour d'autres représentations artistiques. Parmi les opéras les plus célèbres, on trouve le théâtre du Globe de Londres, où eut lieu la première représentation de la plupart des oeuvres de William Shakespeare, l'opéra de Sydney, l'un des bâtiments les plus marquants et les plus célèbres du XXe siècle, et la Scala de Milan.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Opernhaus ist ein Gebäude, in dem Opern aufgeführt werden. Es ist baulich normalerweise speziell für derartige Aufführungen konzipiert, es können aber auch andere darstellende Künste dargeboten werden. Berühmte Opernhäuser sind zum Beispiel das Globe Theatre in London, in dem die meisten Stücke von William Shakespeare uraufgeführt wurden, das Sydney Opera House, eins der markantesten und berühmtesten Bauwerke des 20. Jahrhunderts, sowie das Teatro alla Scala in Mailand.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un teatro dell'opera è un teatro in cui vengono rappresentate le opere. Solitamente sono costruiti in maniera specifica con in mente l'opera, anche se vi si possono tenere anche altri spettacoli. Fra i teatri dell'opera più conosciuti si annovera anche il Globe Theatre di Londra, in cui vennero rappresentati per la prima volta quasi tutti i lavori di Shakespeare, e il teatro dell'opera di Sydney, uno dei più particolari e famosi edifici del 20° secolo, oltre alla Scala di Milano.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un Teatro de la Ópera es un edificio en el que se interpretan óperas. Las instalaciones se suelen construir específicamente para la representación de óperas, aunque también pueden albergar otro tipo de actuaciones. Algunos de los teatros de ópera más famosos son el Globe Theatre de Londres, donde se presentaron la mayoría de las obras de William Shakespeare por primera vez, la Opera House de Sydney, uno de los edificios más famosos del siglo XX y La Scala de Milán.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Grand Canal in China, also known as the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal is the longest canal or artificial river in the world. Starting at Beijing, it passes through Tianjin and the provinces of Hebei, Shandong, Jiangsu and Zhejiang to the city of Hangzhou. The oldest parts of the canal date back to the 5th century BC, although the various sections were finally combined during the Sui Dynasty (581-618 AD).[NEWLINE][TAB]The total length of the Grand Canal is 1,776 km (1,103 miles). Its greatest height is reached in the mountains of Shandong, at a summit of 42 m (138 ft). Ships in Chinese canals did not have trouble reaching higher elevations after the pound lock was invented in the 10th century, during the Song Dynasty (960-1279), by the government official and engineer Qiao Weiyo. The canal's size and grandeur won it the admiration of many throughout history, including the Japanese monk Ennin (794-864), the Persian historian Rashid al-Din (1247-1318), the Korean official Choe Bu (1454-1504) and the Italian missionary Matteo Ricci (1552-1610).[NEWLINE][TAB]Historically, periodic flooding of the adjacent Yellow River threatened the safety and functioning of the canal. During wartime the high dikes of the Yellow River were sometimes deliberately broken in order to flood advancing enemy troops. This caused disaster and prolonged economic hardships. Despite temporary periods of desolation and disuse, the Grand Canal furthered an indigenous and growing economic market in China's urban centers through all the ages since the Sui period.

[TAB]The Three Gorges Dam project is designed to tap the power of the mighty Yangtze River, the third longest river in the world. Construction began in Hubei Province, China, in 1994, and was completed in 2012. It is 607 feet high and runs 1.4 miles, making it the largest hydroelectric dam in the world. The final cost was $26 billion dollars. [PARAGRAPH:2]Constructing a dam on the Yangtze was proposed as far back as 1919 by Sun Yat-sen, but the idea was shelved for 40 years due to a series of wars, revolutions, and other national calamities hitting China. The idea was resurrected in 1954, abandoned, resurrected again in 1963, abandoned, and so on until it was given final approval in 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]There was much debate over the project, primarily because it dislocated almost two million people, but also because of its potentially devastating environmental impact and because it has eradicated 1300 archeological sites in the area. The Chinese government has pushed the project forward despite these objections and despite the unprecedented opposition of over 30%% of the delegates to the National People's Congress, a body which usually rubber-stamps government decisions.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le barrage des Trois Gorges doit servir à exploiter l'énergie fournie par le puissant fleuve Yangzi Jiang, le troisième plus long fleuve du monde. La construction a débuté en 1994, dans la province du Hubei, en Chine, et devrait s'achever en 2009. L'ouvrage devrait alors mesurer 182 m de haut et s'étendre sur 2 km, ce qui en fera le plus grand barrage hydroélectrique du monde. Le gouvernement chinois évalue le coût final à 30 milliards de dollars, tandis que des experts indépendants l'estiment plus près de 75 milliards. [PARAGRAPH:2]La construction d'un barrage sur le Yangzi Jiang avait été proposée en 1919 par Sun Yat-sen, mais l'idée était restée en suspens pendant 40 ans en raison des guerres, des révolutions et autres désastres nationaux ayant touché la Chine. Le projet renaît en 1954, est à nouveau abandonné, renaît une nouvelle fois en 1963, est de nouveau abandonné avant d'être définitivement approuvé en 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le projet a suscité de nombreux débats : près de deux millions de personnes doivent être relogées, son impact sur l'environnement est jugé potentiellement dévastateur et sa construction fait disparaître pas moins de 1 300 sites archéologiques dans cette zone. Le gouvernement chinois a finalement adopté ce projet, en dépit de ces objections et de l'opposition sans précédent de plus de 30 %% des représentants du Congrès national populaire, qui entérine d'ordinaire sans discuter les décisions du gouvernement.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Drei-Schluchten-Staudamm wird gebaut, um den Jangtse, den größten Fluss der Welt, einzudämmen. In der chinesischen Provinz Hubei begann man 1994 mit dem Bau, der 2009 fertig gestellt werden soll. Der 180 Meter hohe und 2 Kilometer breite Damm ist der längste hydraulische Damm der Welt. Die chinesische Regierung schätzt die Baukosten auf etwa 30 Milliarden Dollar. Unabhängige Experten gehen allerdings von mindestens 75 Milliarden Dollar aus. [PARAGRAPH:2]Der Damm wurde bereits im Jahr 1919 von Sun Yat-sen vorgeschlagen. Aufgrund verschiedener Kriege, Revolutionen und anderer nationaler Schicksalsschläge konnte die Idee allerdings 40 Jahre lang nicht verwirklicht werden. 1954 und 1963 griff man sie erneut auf, verwarf sie aber erneut. [PARAGRAPH:2]Das Projekt ist umstritten, weil etwa zwei Millionen Menschen umgesiedelt werden müssen und 1300 historische und archäologische Stätten unwiederbringlich zerstört werden. Darüber hinaus sind die Auswirkungen für das Ökosystem der Region nicht abzusehen. Trotz aller Bedenken und des Widerstandes innerhalb der Bevölkerung (etwa 30%% der Abgeordneten des Nationalen Volkskongresses sind gegen den Damm) treibt die chinesische Regierung das Projekt weiter voran.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il progetto della Diga delle Tre Gole è stato realizzato per attingere dalla potenza del grande fiume Yangtze, il terzo corso d'acqua più grande del mondo. La costruzione cominciò nella provincia di Hubei nel 1994 in Cina e verrà completata nel 2009: al termine dei lavori, la diga sarà alta quasi 200 metri per una lunghezza di due chilometri, diventando la diga idroelettrica più grande del mondo. Il governo Cinese ha stimato che il costo totale dei lavori si aggirerà attorno ai 30 miliardi di dollari, mentre fonti indipendenti dicono che la cifra reale sarà di 75 milioni di dollari. [PARAGRAPH:2]La costruzione di una diga sullo Yangtze venne proposta per la prima volta nel 1919 da Sun Yat-sen, ma a causa di una serie di guerre, rivuoluzioni e altre calamità naturali, che hanno colpito la Cina nei successivi 40 anni, il progetto venne riesumato nel 1954 per essere abbandonato e ripreso nel 1963 e così via fino al 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]Si è molto discusso su questo progetto, principalmente perché la sua realizzazione prevedeva lo sfollamento di due milioni di persone, ma anche perché può avere un devastante impatto ambientale che distruggerà la bellezza do 1300 siti archeologici nella zona. Il governo Cinese ha mandato comunque avanti il progetto malgrado il 30%% dei delegati del Congresso Nazionalpoplare fosse contro questa opera.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El proyecto de la presa de las Tres Gargantas está diseñado para explotar la energía del Yangtzé, el tercer río más largo del mundo. Se empezó a construir en la provincia de Hubei, China, en 1994, y está previsto que se acabe en el 2009. Cuando esté terminada, tendrá doscientos metros de altura y unos dos kilómetros de largo, lo que la convertirá en la mayor presa hidroeléctrica del mundo. El gobierno chino estima que su coste final será de unos treinta mil millones de dólares, aunque expertos independientes lo cifran en setenta y cinco mil millones. [PARAGRAPH:2]La construcción de una presa en el Yangtzé ya fue propuesta en 1919 por Sun Yat-sen, pero la idea se tuvo que aparcar durante cuarenta años debido a una serie de guerras, revoluciones y otras calamidades nacionales que afligieron a China. La idea se recuperó en 1954, se abandonó de nuevo, se volvió a desechar en 1963 y así sucesivamente hasta que finalmente se le dio el visto bueno en 1992. [PARAGRAPH:2]El proyecto ha sido muy controvertido, básicamente porque desahuciará a dos millones de personas, pero también por su impacto potencialmente devastador en el entorno y debido a que comportará la desaparición de mil trescientos yacimientos arqueológicos en la zona. El gobierno chino ha impulsado el proyecto pese a estas objeciones y la oposición sin precedentes de alrededor del 30%% de los delegados del Congreso Nacional Popular, un órgano que suele refrendar las decisiones gubernamentales.

TEXT.English: The ancient Indus Valley Civilization of Northwest South Asia, including Pakistan and parts of India, was prominent in hydraulic engineering, and had many water supply and sanitation devices that were the first of their kind.[PARAGRAPH:1]Among other things, they contain the world's earliest known system of flush toilets. These existed in many homes, and were connected to a common sewerage pipe. Most houses also had private wells. City walls functioned as a barrier against floods.[PARAGRAPH:1]Mohenjo-daro is one of the best excavated and studied settlements from this civilization. The Great Bath might be the first of its kind in pre-historic period. This ancient town had more than 700 wells, and most houses in Mohenjo-daro had one private well.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dholavira, located in Gujarat, India, had a series of water storing tanks and step wells, and its water management system has been called "unique". Dholavira had at least five baths, size of one is comparable with Great Bath, Mohenjadaro.

[TAB]The Harmandir Sahib, also referred to as the Golden Temple, is a prominent Sikh Gurdwara located in the city of Amritsar, Punjab, India. Construction of the Gurdwara was begun by Guru Ram Das ji, the fourth Sikh Guru, and completed by his successor, Guru Arjan Dev ji. In 1604, Guru Arjan Dev ji completed the Adi Granth, the holy scripture of Sikhism, and installed it in the Gurdwara. In 1634, Guru Hargobind left Amritsar for the Shivalik Hills and for the remainder of the seventeenth century the city and Gurdwara was in the hands of forces hostile to the Sikh Gurus. During the eighteenth century, Sri Harmandir Sahib was the site of frequent fighting between the Sikhs on one side and either Mughal or Afghan forces on the other side and the Gurdwara occasionally suffered damage. In the early nineteenth century, Maharaja Ranjit Singh secured the Punjab region from outside attack and covered the upper floors of the Gurdwara with gold, which gives it its distinctive appearance and English name of "Golden Temple".[PARAGRAPH:1]The present day Golden Temple was rebuilt in 1764 by Maharaja Jassa Singh Ahluwalia (1718-1783) with the help of other Misl Sikh chieftains.The gold plating of all the domes of Sri Darbar Sahib was done by Maharaja Jassa Singh Ahluwalia's descendents. Between 1802-1830 Ranjit Singh did the sewa of adding gold plating and marble to the Gurdwara, while the interior was decorated with fresco work and gemstones.

[TAB]A national gallery is a country's major public art gallery. With different names, they are widespread in almost every nation capital. They are a space for the exhibition of art, usually visual art, and usually primarily paintings, illustrations, and sculpture. The art museum is considered a fairly modern invention, the first being the Louvre in Paris, which was established in 1793, soon after the French Revolution when the royal treasures were declared for the people.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une galerie nationale est la principale galerie d'art ouverte au public dans un pays. Bien que les appellations changent suivant les pays, on en trouve une dans presque chaque capitale du monde. Ces bâtiments servent à exposer les arts _ généralement visuels _ et notamment les peintures, les illustrations et les sculptures. On considère que le musée d'art est une invention assez moderne ; le plus ancien est le Louvre, qui ouvrit en 1793, peu après la Révolution française, lorsque les trésors royaux ont été déclarés propriété du peuple.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Nationalgalerie ist die größte öffentlich zugängliche Kunstgalerie eines Landes. Diese Galerien sind unter verschiedenen Bezeichnungen in fast allen Hauptstädten weit verbreitet und dienen als Ausstellungsorte für Kunst, meist bildende Kunst, und zwar in erster Linie für Gemälde, Illustrationen und Skulpturen. Das Kunstmuseum als solches ist eine relativ moderne Einrichtung: Die erste Institution dieser Art war der Pariser Louvre, der erst 1793 - kurz nach der französischen Revolution - gebaut wurde, nachdem die königlichen Schätze per Dekret dem Volk zugänglich gemacht worden waren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Una galleria nazionale è la principale galleria d'arte pubblica di una nazione. Con diversi nomi se ne trovano in quasi ogni capitale. Sono uno spazio per l'esibizione dell'arte, solitamente visiva, e principalmente dipinti, illustrazioni e sculture. Il museo d'arte è considerato un'invenzione abbastanza moderna: il primo è quello del Louvre a Parigi fondato nel 1793, poco dopo la rivoluzione francese, quando i tesori reali vennero dichiarati di proprietà del popolo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Una galería nacional es un gran museo de arte público de un país. Recibe diferentes nombres, pero casi todas las capitales del mundo cuentan con una de ellas. Hay un espacio para la exhibición de elementos artísticos, normalmente artes visuales, fundamentalmente pintura, ilustración y escultura. El museo de arte se considera una invención relativamente moderna. El primero de ellos fue el Louvre en París, fundado en 1793, al poco de finalizar la Revolución Francesa y tras declarar públicos los bienes de la realeza.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Himeji Castle is a hilltop Japanese castle complex located in Himeji in Hyogo Prefecture. The castle is regarded as the finest surviving example of prototypical Japanese castle architecture, comprising a network of 83 buildings with advanced defensive systems from the feudal period. The castle is frequently known as Hakurojou or Shirasagijou ("White Heron Castle") because of its brilliant white exterior and supposed resemblance to a bird taking flight.[PARAGRAPH:2]Himeji Castle dates to 1333, when Akamatsu Norimura built a fort on top of Himeyama hill. The fort was dismantled and rebuilt as Himeyama Castle in 1346, and then remodeled into Himeji Castle two centuries later. Himeji Castle was then significantly remodeled in 1581 by Toyotomi Hideyoshi, who added a three-story castle keep. In 1600, Tokugawa Ieyasu awarded the castle to Ikeda Terumasa for his help in the Battle of Sekigahara, and Ikeda completely rebuilt the castle from 1601 to 1609, expanding it into a large castle complex. Several buildings were later added to the castle complex by Honda Tadamasa from 1617 to 1618. For over 400 years, Himeji Castle has remained intact, even throughout the extensive bombing of Himeji in World War II, and natural disasters such as the 1995 Great Hanshin earthquake.[NEWLINE][TAB]Himeji Castle is the largest and most visited castle in Japan, and it was registered in 1993 as one of the first UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the country. The area within the middle moat of the castle complex is a designated Special Historic Site and five structures of the castle are also designated National Treasures. Along with Matsumoto Castle and Kumamoto Castle, Himeji Castle is considered one of Japan's three premier castles. In order to preserve the castle buildings, it is currently undergoing restoration work that is expected to continue for several years.

[TAB]Tambos (Quechua for "inn") were Incan structures built for administrative and military purposes. They were found alongside the Incan road network. They typically carried supplies, and served as lodging for itinerant state personnel (such as chasquis, Incan messengers, and quipucamayocs, those who could read and create quipus, for example) and as depositories of quipu-based records. Swift communication was achieved through the tambo network, and messages reached their destinations effectively and efficiently.[PARAGRAPH:1]Remains of tambos are scattered throughout modern-day Peru, Bolivia, Chile, and Colombia. Spanish conquistador and chronicler Pedro Cieza de León made numerous references to the tambos in his "Crónicas de Perú". In the following passage, Cieza de León described the general uses for the tambos that he learned from native peoples:[PARAGRAPH:1]And so there would be adequate supplies for their men, every four leagues there were lodgings and storehouses, and the representatives or stewards who lived in the capital of the provinces took great care to see that the natives kept these inns or lodgings (tambos) well supplied. And so certain of them would not give more than others, and all should make their contribution, they kept the accounts by a method of knots, which they call quipus, and in this way, after the troops had passed by, they could check and see that there had been no fraud.
